subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0323_01C9E8E2.740FB850
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Phew! LOL!!!

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Ratka 
  To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, June 09, 2009 8:58 AM
  Subject: Re=
: [EVP-ITC] New ideas





        Yes! LOL

        --- On Tue, 6/9/09, Ap=
ril Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:


          Fro=
m: April Abercrombie <april@...>
          Subject=
: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          D=
ate: Tuesday, June 9, 2009, 8:50 AM


          Well what I meant was that =
if we are keeping sound separate from the EM spectrum, then it is generated=
 as a bi-product of some other thing's movements or vibrations. Such moveme=
nts create waves in the environment that we hear as sound.

            ---=
-- Original Message ----- 
            From: Frank Ratka 
            To: E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            Sent: Tuesday, June 09, 2009 6:27 AM
 =
           Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                  No, that's =
not what I mean. By nature EM waves don't normally make sound. The HAARP is=
sue in the NW is believe to be caused by some harmonic of the actual EM wav=
e. This is what I mean by secondary effect. EM waves can still effect the p=
hysical, which is the reason microwaves can cook you if the power is amped =
high enough or causes a birds to twitch in its transmission beam. I have st=
epped into a microwave beam at moderate power in while in the military. It =
doesn't hurt (at least at the power it was at) but it sure made me feel ver=
y strange. Of course microwaves have very short wavelengths compared to VLF=
, ULF or SLF.

                  Frank R.

                  --- On Mon, 6/=
8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


   =
                 From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. =
com>
                    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                 =
   To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                    Date: Monday, June 8, 2=
009, 3:49 PM


                    Right...gotcha. Sound is a bi-product mo=
re or less.

                      ----- Original Message ----- 
          =
            From: Frank Ratka 
                      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s .com 
                      Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:46 PM
         =
             Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                           =
 EM waves at the VLF and ULF level can give off sound but only as a seconda=
ry phenomenon. It sounds like a low hum to some people! I believe the most =
famous of these phenomenon was caused by HAARP.

                          =
  --- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. c=
om> wrote:


                              From: April Abercrombie <april@a=
bercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                              Subject: Re: [=
EVP-ITC] New ideas
                              To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .c=
om
                              Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 3:43 PM


    =
                          So everything can be defined as from one of these=
 forces. Objects from these forces can omit sound waves.

                 =
             Does that sound like a correct statement? Just trying to get m=
y mind around it.

                                ----- Original Message -=
---- 
                                From: Rj 
                           =
     To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                                Sent: Mo=
nday, June 08, 2009 2:33 PM
                                Subject: Re: [E=
VP-ITC] New ideas


                                April, standard physics=
 today defines four fundamental types of forces: electromagnetism, gravity,=
  and the strong and weak interaction of elementary particles.  So while EM=
 is one type of energy (well, lets call it a force), there are a few others=
 too.


                                --- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercromb=
ie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


                        =
        From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
    =
                            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
              =
                  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                            =
    Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:21 PM


                                T=
his seems to jive with what I have learned this far, but I am still not cer=
tain I understand it completely.

                                I thought=
 everything was based in the electromagnetic spectrum.

                   =
             ----- Original Message ----- 
                                =
From: Frank Ratka 
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups =
.com 
                                Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:05 PM
 =
                               Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


         =
                       Tell me where the seperation on the spectrum takes p=
lace between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure waves that ou=
r ears read as vibration and our mind translates as sound. The waves are st=
ill on the electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic geomagnetic waves are pr=
esent on the scale. What I mean by power can be directll translated to volu=
me or amplitude. The only thing that distinguishes soundwaves from any othe=
r wave is the fact that we can hear them.

                                =
Frank R.

                                --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@=
yahoo. com> wrote:


                                From: Rj <rasterer@yah=
oo. com>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
 =
                               To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
               =
                 Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:53 PM


                    =
            No. Sounds waves are not on the electromagnet spectrum nor are =
they a form of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on pressure wave=
s in the air (or in other substances).  Our ears detect these pressure wave=
s and translate them into sounds we here.  Our ear do NOT hear electromagne=
t energy.  Our eyes do: that part which we call visible light.



         =
                       --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo=
.com> wrote:


                                From: Frank Ratka <warrior18=
eii@ yahoo.com>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New =
ideas
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
        =
                        Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM


            =
                    It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."

        =
                        A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking tha=
t there are two different types of energy at work when it comes to sound wa=
ves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is freque=
ncy and power. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain bl=
ock of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectr=
um just farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves =
can penetrate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter the=
 wavelength the more ways we can shield against them.

                    =
            Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio and telemet=
ry transmitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on our envir=
onment by causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A little lower=
 than this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to heat up b=
ut usually it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical things=
 give off IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy by spontane=
ously emitting IR radiation.

                                Frank R.

   =
                             --- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@a=
bercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


                                Fro=
m: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
               =
                 Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments]
         =
                       To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                       =
         Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM


                            =
    Here is some food for thought. I am currently reviewing my audio from o=
ur May 30th investigation.

                                It was me and a=
nother girl teammate present in the room. I picked up a 3rd female voice on=
 my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were standing right nex=
t to another digital video recorder that I leave beside my night vision cam=
era. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the girl th=
at was with me to check her recording to see if she picked it up.

        =
                        I have long felt the true EVP does not come from so=
und waves in the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied=
 voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.

          =
                      This instance with the recorders may back that theory=
 up. That other recorder should have picked that voice up if it were sound =
waves in the environment.

                                I am attaching t=
he clip of this 3rd voice. The file that is named "01-02-17 Clip" is the fu=
ll clip. You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then another comes in =
right after that. I think I know what it says.

                           =
     Again, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this unt=
il playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's fr=
om the last investigation.


                                ----- Original=
 Message ----- 
                                From: Frank Ratka 
        =
                        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                     =
           Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
                            =
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                                I ha=
ve a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulat=
ed exactly where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne prin=
ciple. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequency=
 then if you add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or alte=
rnate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and y=
ou have an electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz=
 then you will have a intermediate difference frequency at 9KHz, well withi=
n human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all el=
ectronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. Fr=
om this theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of=
 the recorder.

                                We are able to reproduce th=
is affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with acou=
stics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce called t=
he "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.

                              =
  Frank R.

                                --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup =
<w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrote:


                                From: Zack =
Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
                                Subject: Re: [=
EVP-ITC] New ideas
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups =
.com
                                Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM


=
                                Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EV=
P are often not recorded by the microphone but somehow make their way in at=
 the actual point where the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or=
 digital. 

                                So much we don't know ...

    =
                            Zack

                                 
       =
                         On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie =
<april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:




                         =
       I monitor my audio live. The funny thing is that even so, those last=
 EVP's I captured I did not hear either in the environment, or on my record=
ing as it happened. I only heard them upon playback.

                     =
           ----- Original Message ----- 
                                Fr=
om: Zack Widup 
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .co=
m 
                                Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
   =
                             Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


           =
                     I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a re=
mote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.

                          =
      I took part in an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, =
on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls of th=
e building. The video for all was being monitored and recorded at a central=
 location. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites conected t=
o the central location. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?

     =
                           Zack

                                 
        =
                        On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ jun=
o.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:


                                Le=
t's just agree to end this discussion about her... 
                       =
         Why don't we discuss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any =
new ideas about either evp or ITC? 
                                Al

   =
                              

                                 

        =
                         

                                 

             =
                    

                           

                 

     =

              <TD vAlign=3Dtop>
                                <DIV>Tell m=
e where the seperation on the 
                                spectrum tak=
es place between 300Hz and 300KHz. 
                                Yes, so=
undwaves cause pressure waves that our 
                                ear=
s read as vibration and our mind translates 
                              =
  as sound. The waves are still on the 
                                ele=
ctromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic 
                                geoma=
gnetic waves are present on the scale. What 
                              =
  I mean by power can be directll translated to 
                          =
      volume or amplitude. The only thing that 
                           =
     distinguishes soundwaves from any other wave is 
                     =
           the fact that we can hear them.</DIV>
                          =
      <DIV> </DIV>
                                <DIV>Frank R.<BR><B=
R>--- On <B>Mon, 6/8/09, Rj 
                                <I><rastere=
r@yahoo. com></I></B> 
                                wrote:<BR></DIV>
=
                                <BLOCKQUOTE 
                              =
  style=3D"BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid"><BR>From: 
              =
                  Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com><BR>Subject: Re: 
         =
                       [EVP-ITC] New ideas<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups 
    =
                            .com<BR>Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:53 
     =
                           PM<BR><BR>

id=3Dyiv687936166>
                                <DIV id=3Dygrp-text>
   =
                             <DIV>
                                <TABLE b=
order=3D0 cellSpacing=3D0 cellPadding=3D0>
                                =
<TBODY>
                                <TR>
                              =
  <TD vAlign=3Dtop>No. Sounds waves are not on the 
                       =
         electromagnet spectrum nor are they a form of 
                   =
             electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on 
              =
                  pressure waves in the air (or in other 
                 =
               substances).  Our ears detect these 
                  =
              pressure waves and translate them into sounds we 
           =
                     here.  Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet 
       =
                         energy.  Our eyes do: that part which we 
   =
                             call visible light.<BR><BR><BR><BR>--- On 
   =
                             <B>Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <I><warrior18ei=
i@ 
                                yahoo.com></I></B> wrote:<BR>
      =
                          <BLOCKQUOTE 
                                styl=
e=3D"BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid"><BR>From: 
                    =
            Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ 
                                =
yahoo.com><BR>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New 
                              =
  ideas<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com<BR>Date: 
                         =
       Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM<BR><BR>
                             =
   <DIV id=3Dyiv230569257>
                                <DIV id=3Dygrp-t=
ext>
                                <DIV>
                                =
<TABLE border=3D0 cellSpacing=3D0 cellPadding=3D0>
                        =
        <TBODY>
                                <TR>
                      =
          <TD 
                                style=3D"FONT-FAMILY: inheri=
t; font-size-adjust: inherit" 
                                vAlign=3Dtop=
>
                                <DIV>It sounds like she's saying "one, tw=
o, 
                                ....."</DIV>
                          =
      <DIV> </DIV>
                                <DIV>A mistake that=
 a lot of people make is 
                                thinking that the=
re are two different types of 
                                energy at wo=
rk when it comes to sound waves and 
                                electr=
omagnetic waves. The only thing that 
                                seper=
ates them is frequency and power. Radio 
                                wa=
ves are radio waves because they occupy a 
                                =
certain block of the electromagnietic spectrum. 
                          =
      Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just 
                       =
         farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves 
                 =
               and subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything 
          =
                      because of their wavelengths. The shorter the 
      =
                          wavelength the more ways we can shield against 
 =
                               them.</DIV>
                                =
<DIV> </DIV>
                                <DIV>Think of microwaves.=
 These are also a type 
                                of radio and teleme=
try transmitting wave but the 
                                waves also h=
ave a physical effect on our 
                                environment b=
y causing molecules to speed up, 
                                which cre=
ates heat. A little lower than this is 
                                IR =
or infrared it too can cause physical objects 
                            =
    to heat up but usually it just causes molecules 
                      =
          to rotate in place. All physical things give off 
               =
                 IR light. Its a way the total system conserves 
          =
                      energy by spontaneously emitting IR 
                =
                radiation.</DIV>
                                <DIV>&nbsp=
;</DIV>
                                <DIV>Frank R.<BR><BR>--- On <B>Mon,=
 6/8/09, 
                                April Abercrombie <I><april@ab=
ercrombiegh 
                                ostresearch. com></I></B> w=
rote:<BR></DIV>
                                <BLOCKQUOTE 
              =
                  style=3D"BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid"><BR>From:=
 
                                April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh=
 
                                ostresearch. com><BR>Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] 
                                New ideas [3 Attachments]<BR>To: 
  =

e

IV id=3Dygrp-text>
                                <DIV>
                  =
              <DIV><FONT size=3D2 face=3D"Myriad Pro">Here is some 
       =
                         food for thought. I am currently reviewing my 
   =

                     =

                                <DIV=
><FONT size=3D2 
                                face=3D"Myriad Pro"></FONT=
> </DIV>
                                <DIV><FONT size=3D2 face=3D"M=
yriad Pro">It was me 
                                and another girl team=
mate present in the 
                                room. I picked up=
 a 3rd female voice on my 
                                digital voice re=
corder that I carry with me. We 
                                were stand=
ing right next to another digital 
                                video re=
corder that I leave beside my night 
                                vision=
 camera. That recorder did not pick up 
                                thi=
s 3rd voice. I have asked the girl that was 
                              =
  with me to check her recording to see if she 
                           =
     picked it up.</FONT></DIV>
                                <DIV><FONT =
size=3D2 
                                face=3D"Myriad Pro"></FONT> =
</DIV>
                                <DIV><FONT size=3D2 face=3D"Myriad P=
ro">I have long 
                                felt the true EVP does not=
 come from sound waves 
                                in the environment,=
 or then it wouldn't be EVP, 
                                but a disembo=
died voice. Somehow EVP's are 
                                appearing di=
rectly on the 
                                recordings.</FONT></DIV>
   =
                             <DIV><FONT size=3D2 
                         =
       face=3D"Myriad Pro"></FONT> </DIV>
                            =
    <DIV><FONT size=3D2 face=3D"Myriad Pro">This 
                         =
       instance with the recorders may back that theory 
                  =
              up. That other recorder should have picked that 
            =
                    voice up if it were sound waves in the 
               =
                 environment.</FONT></DIV>
                                =
<DIV><FONT size=3D2 
                                face=3D"Myriad Pro"></=
FONT> </DIV>

ed "01-02-17 Clip"

                                I say "Yeah=
", and then another comes in right 
                                after t=
hat. I think I know what it 
                                says.</FONT></=
DIV>

g=3D0>

                            =
    <TR>
                                <TD vAlign=3Dtop>
                =
                <DIV>I have a running theory that EVP is carried 
         =
                       on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly 
     =
                           where they want it to manifest. It works off the=
 
                                heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultr=
asonic 
                                waves that differ one another in fr=
equency then 
                                if you add or subtract them t=
ogether you get a 
                                beat frequency or altern=
ate frequency. For 
                                example, if a ghost is =
sending a signal at 54KHz 
                                and you have an =
electric fan in a room creating 
                                an untraso=
nic frequency at 45KHz then you will 
                                have =
a intermediate difference frequency at 
                              =
  9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 
                         =
       20KHz). This was just an example, but all 
                         =
       electronic equipment generates ultrasonic 
                         =
       signals just by turning them on. From this 
                        =
        theory I always felt that EVP were generated 
                     =
           within a few inches of the recorder.</DIV>
                     =
           <DIV> </DIV>
                                <DIV>We are ab=
le to reproduce this affect in not 
                                only ra=
dio with superheterodyne systems but also 
                                =
with acoustics and audio as in some passive 
                              =
  sonars and a commercial produce called the 
                             =
   "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
                         =
       <DIV> </DIV>
                                <DIV>Frank R.<BR><=
BR>--- On <B>Mon, 6/8/09, Zack 
                                Widup <I>&l=
t;w9sz.zack@gmail. com></I></B> 
                                wrote:<=

                    =
            style=3D"BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid"><BR>From:

                                <DIV =
id=3Dygrp-text>
                                <DIV>
                     =
           <DIV>Fascinating! I've had this idea that the 
                 =
               EVP are often not recorded by the 
                    =
            microphone but somehow make their way in at the 
              =
                  actual point where the storage is made, 
           =
                     whether it be analog (tape) or 
                      =
          digital. <BR></DIV>
                                <DIV>So =
much we don't know ...</DIV>
                                <DIV> </D=
IV>

                  =
              <DIV>I am curious if anyone with a microphone 
              =
                  wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP 
         =
                       in real time.</DIV>
                                =
<DIV> </DIV>
                                <DIV>I took part in&=
nbsp;an investigation 
                                of Ashmore Estates, =
near Ashmore IL, on Saturday 
                                night. We had=
 six video cameras set up in the

ls of the building. The video for 
                                all&nbsp=
;was being monitored and 
                                recorded at =
a central location. Alas, we 
                                did not have =
microphones at the camera sites 
                                conected t=
o the central location. I wonder what 
                                we m=
ight have heard if we did?</DIV>
